definition: hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: My wife keeps pecking at me.
sentences.chinese: 我老婆不断地挑我的毛病。

sentences.english: We're having a spot of bother with the new machine.
sentences.chinese: 我们的新机器有一点小毛病。

sentences.english: My grand-father was always buying himself new suits of clothes, it was a foible of his.
sentences.chinese: 我祖父经常给自己买新衣服，这是他的毛病。

sentences.english: But after we had started to uphold the precept of not stealing, our lung and nose problesm will gradually diminish.
sentences.chinese: 当我们持守不偷盗戒后，肺部和鼻子只出些小毛病。

sentences.english: They took him to specialists， but the doctors found nothing wrong with him.
sentences.chinese: 他们带他去找专家诊治，但医生们总觉得他没有毛病。

sentences.english: "Yes, something did happen, " Taras said, with a smile.
sentences.chinese: “出了一点毛病，”塔拉斯笑眯眯地说。

sentences.english: Did your 240 have that problem with the sticky parking-brake cable?
sentences.chinese: 你的240有驻车制动拉线方面的毛病吗？

sentences.english: I want to all don't pick trouble to anything, also hands -off or teach other people.
sentences.chinese: 我要对任何事都不挑毛病，也不干涉或教训别人。

sentences.english: What's wrong with the distributor is that the distributor cap is cracked.
sentences.chinese: 配电器的毛病，就是出在盖子破裂了。

sentences.english: Or wait until the trouble to repair, often has a very serious problem.
sentences.chinese: 否则等到出毛病才送修，往往问题已经很严重。

sentences.english: The boy has a shortcoming, which is telling lies and playing tricks on others.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子有一个坏毛病，就是喜欢说谎，爱搞恶作剧。

sentences.english: This gives you the opportunity to correct the particular fault.
sentences.chinese: 因为，它给你一个机遇来纠正这个特别的毛病。

sentences.english: There is a fault in this machine.
Does your child stall when it comes time to do homework?
sentences.chinese: 做作业的时候你的孩子有拖沓的毛病吗？

sentences.english: The only problem is that it's fragile and brittle, and that means it breaks easily.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的毛病在于它脆弱而易碎，也就是说很容易坏掉。

sentences.english: She damned his character for a few faults.
sentences.chinese: 她抓住一点点毛病就说他的品质很坏。

definition: lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
to have sth go wrong/to have a problem arise/to give problems
an incompletely cured illness/an old complaint/the root cause of trouble
